short_summary: Report on Visitor Use Patterns at Lake Minnewanka, Banff National Park
description: The Park Canada Agency is accepting bids for a "Report on Visitor Use Patterns at Lake Minnewanka, Banff National Park," which requires a contractor to complete data analysis. The scope of work will be focused on analysis of visitor use data (existing data, and potential new data) for the whole Lake Minnewanka Area (LMA) along with recommended solutions and answers to different questions.
full_summary:
### Report on Visitor Use Patterns at Lake Minnewanka, Banff National Park

#### Solicitation Information

*   Solicitation Number: 5P421-23-0044/A
*   Publication Date: October 30, 2023
*   Tender Closing Date: November 20, 2023, at 16:00:00
*   Expected Contract Start Date: December 1, 2023
*   Expected Contract End Date: March 29, 2024

#### Request for Proposal (RFP)

Parks Canada requires a contractor to complete data analysis for the entire Lake Minnewanka Area (LMA). The scope of work will focus on analyzing existing and potential new visitor use data, along with providing recommended solutions and answers to various questions.

#### Bid Submission Requirements

Bids received by fax or email will be accepted as official. Due to current system limitations, Parks Canada is not accepting bids via SAP Ariba. Contractors must submit their bids via fax or email as indicated in the solicitation document. In-person or courier submissions will not be accepted.

#### Important Contact Information

*   Contact Person: Rose Marino
*   Email Address:  soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca
*   Phone Number: (403) 760-1319
*   Fax Number: 1-866-246-6893

#### Additional Submission Requirements

*   The maximum email file size that Parks Canada can receive is 15 megabytes.
*   Contractors should be aware of the overall email size, not just the attachments. If the email size is too large, contractors should submit the bid in multiple emails labeled with the solicitation number, project name, and the number of emails included.

#### Documents

*   Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
*   Contractors must obtain documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service at [http://canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca).
*   Addenda, when issued, will be available on the same platform.

#### Conditions of Submission

*   The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
*   Late submissions will not be considered.

#### Mandatory Bidders' Conference

A mandatory bidders' conference will be held on November 8, 2023, at 10:00 AM Mountain Time as a Microsoft Teams Meeting. The conference will cover the scope of the requirement outlined in the bid solicitation, and questions
